text: so this is the leaflet that's going to
be landing on doorsteps and when you
come to fact check it it's important to
distinguish between things that are
clear facts and you can tell whether
they're true or false and that's things
like saying that EU countries by forty
four percent of everything we sell
abroad and that's true and on the flip
side over three million UK jobs are
linked to exports to the EU nao the
calculation there's a little bit suspect
it's a Treasury number but it's it's not
a very precise one so that's a bit
suspect and from those things that are
clearly facts then you look at things
where you've had to make assumptions
about what would happen in the case of
the UK leaving the EU so that's things
like it would put pressure on the value
of the pound which would risk higher
prices of household goods and damage
living standards now we have seen the
pound fall a bit during this referendum
campaign but it wouldn't necessarily
happen if we left the e u-- so that's an
assumption they've made and then there
are things that are clearly just the
government's judgment and to be fair
they've said in a lot of cases in here
that it is a government judgment is this
the government judges it could result in
10 years of uncertainty as the UK
unpicked our relationship with the EU so
again you can't say it's true or false
it's just what the government thinks and
it's not claiming that this is an
unbiased balance report
